intro: Berkheya stobaeoides, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble those of the oxalis genus. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous small, daisy-like flowers in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in arid regions.
